data.title: Sarah Silverman Biography

data.text:
QUICK FACTS

Activities Actress , Executive Producer , Designer more

Real name Sarah Kate Silverman

Nationality USA

Born December 1, 1970 (Bedford, New Hampshire, USA)

BIOGRAPHY

Sarah Kate Silverman was born on December 1, 1970 in Bedford, New Hampshire, USA.

Silverman first performed stand-up comedy in Boston at age 17. She described her performance as “horrible.” After graduating from The Derryfield School in Manchester (class of 1989), she attended New York University for a year but did not graduate . Instead, she performed stand-up comedy in Greenwich Village.

After starting stand-up comedy in 1992, she was part of the 1993-94 season of Saturday Night Live (SNL) for 18 weeks as a writer and featured actress. She was fired after one season . She also starred in the HBO sketch comedy series Mr. Show (1995-1997) and had the lead role in the 1997 independent film Who’s the Caboose? .

Silverman made several television show guest appearances, including on Star Trek: Voyager in the two-part voyage episode ” Future’s End ” (1996); and on Seinfeld in the episode ” The Money ” (1997) .

Her television series The Sarah Silverman program debuted on Comedy Central in February 2007. The series had 1.81 million viewers and portrayed the daily adventures of the fictionalized versions of Silverman, her sister Laura, and her friends.

In 2013, HBO announced that she would star with Patti LuPone and Topher Grace in a sitcom pilot called People in New Jersey, produced by SNL ‘s Lorne Michaels . The pilot was not selected to become a series.

In 2017, Silverman became the host of a new talk show on Hulu called I Love You, America .
